department: College of Computing and Digital Media
biography: As a management consultant and manager, Ms. Ward has worked worldwide with a broad range of companies from consulting firms (Deloitte and Touche, Software AG) to the Fortune 1000 (Motorola, Sears, AMOCO, and CNA). Her roles and assignments span business strategy, corporate processes, and IT design and implementation. As Manager of Corporate Financial Systems for Motorola she was responsible for Corporate, European, Middle East and Japanese initiatives. While at Deloitte and Touche, she also had the benefit of European and North American assignments revolving around organizational assessment and IT processes. Today her consulting practice focuses on business strategy with a special interest in IT research for the investment community. <br><br>Teaching has been a lifelong passion. Ms. Ward has taught face to face (f2f) for over 10 years as an adjunct management professor for Chicago based universities. For ten years, she has taught online Management and Strategy courses for Educasia and other MBA programs.<br><br>Ms. Ward earned her MBA from Northwestern University?s Kellogg School of Management. She holds a BS in Mathematics from Wheaton College. In addition, she completed postgraduate work in Organizational Behavior and Strategy at the University of Illinois at Chicago. Her academic research interests lie in cultural diversity.
